intro: Stenogyne sororia, commonly known as the Hawaiian honeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Stenogyne sororia plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a symbol of Hawaiian cultural heritage.
